bug.short_desc: Request for 64bit Linux SWT builds to have GCC3 and GCC4 DSOs like 32bit SWT builds

long_desc.thetext:
The 32bit version of SWT ship with pairs of files like:
libswt-mozilla18-profile-gtk-3235.so libswt-mozilla18-profile-gcc3-gtk-3235.so
It appears that "gcc3" is liked against GCC3 and stdc++.so.5, while the other is linked against the newer GCC 4 ABI using stdc++.so.6. Would it be possible to have the same arrangement for the 64bit distributions for SWT.
Some Linux operating system distributions come with both compilers installed. "ls /usr/bin/gcc*" and "gcc -v" and "gcc32 -v" so if the build process was modified it should be possible to use a single machine to obtain both.
The problem this poses is that natively many linux distributions use gcc 4 now by default its the newer ABI and been around now for a little while.
The 32 bit versions come like this:
$ ldd libswt-mozilla18-profile-gtk-3235.so linux-gate.so.1 => (0xffffe000) libxpcom.so => not found libstdc++.so.6 => /usr/lib/libstdc++.so.6 (0xf7e2b000) libm.so.6 => /lib/libm.so.6 (0xf7e06000) libgcc_s.so.1 => /lib/libgcc_s.so.1 (0xf7dfc000) libc.so.6 => /lib/libc.so.6 (0xf7cd2000) /lib/ld-linux.so.2 (0x56555000)
$ ldd libswt-mozilla18-profile-gcc3-gtk-3235.so linux-gate.so.1 => (0xffffe000) libxpcom.so => not found libstdc++.so.5 => /usr/lib/libstdc++.so.5 (0xf7e59000) libm.so.6 => /lib/libm.so.6 (0xf7e34000) libgcc_s.so.1 => /lib/libgcc_s.so.1 (0xf7e2a000) libc.so.6 => /lib/libc.so.6 (0xf7d00000) /lib/ld-linux.so.2 (0x56555000)
Moving to SWT for comment.
yes, this is needed

Fixed > 1003. This should be considered for 3.2.2.
Darryl I notice that you asked a question (that contained several questions) on the newsgroup lately about building mozilla from scratch. Do you still want an answer posted there, or were you just trying to find a fix for this bug's issue (so it's no longer needed)?

First of all Thanks for addressing this issue.
My newsgroup posting was to seek public clarification (and new FAQ points to document the answer) to some of the remaining questions I have after reading the current FAQ.
* How does the GCC3/GCC4 ABI resolution process work and what considerations might there be in relation to this aspect of ensuring compatability.
* What versions of Mozilla and which mozilla end products (FF/SM/XR/etc) are: 1) known to be compatiable, 2) should be compatible, please file reports is found not to be, 3) known to be too old, have bugs and will never be compatible.
* What is the recommended way to build your own compatible Mozilla distribution from the ground up. Does building xulrunner solve most of the answers and when looking to the future; would an xulrunner approach be the most compatible with where SWT is going in the future.
* One of the FAQ points relates to incorrect linking with some of Mozilla's internal libraries that are supplied in some Linux distributions. What options must I use when building my own Mozilla to ensure a compatible build of Mozilla. The FAQ point highlights the distribution but doesn't explain how to verify your own distribution is good or bad, nor provide guidance about the issue when building your own Mozilla. I suspect the problem can be detected using "ldd libxpcom.so".
* How can I ensure my custom build of Mozilla is being picked up by SWT, instead of one that maybe present and supplied by the OS distribution. To put another way how can I ensure I get to override which Mozilla base path is being used, does MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME achieve this purpose? The Eclipse ATF project uses xulrunner exclusively and it relies on $HOME/.gre.d/*conf files.
My point of view relate to issues faced by any adoptor wishing to bundle Mozilla with Eclipse when shipping their product. Or someone wishing to work with bleeding edge versions of Mozilla.
So yes, please address the newsgroup when you've got a minute to round up your thoughts.

bug.short_desc: Two PDE errors when installing Callisto 3.2.1 M20060921-0945

long_desc.thetext:
Not sure if these are a big deal, but I figured it was worth reporting it anyway.
Steps to reproduce:
0) Download eclipse-platform-M20060921-0945-win32.zip; unpack, eg., into C:\nickb\callisto\M20060921-0945 1) Add callisto staging site to UM wizard; install everything in one go (about 200M) into a folder other than the default, eg., C:\nickb\callisto\callisto-plugins. 2) restart Eclipse. Open Error Log view (ALT-SHIFT-Q,Q). Note the following errors:
Could not install bundle ../../callisto-plugins/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.preferences_3.2.1.R32x_v20060717.jar Bundle "org.eclipse.equinox.preferences" version "3.2.1.R32x_v20060717" has already been installed from: update@plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.preferences_3.2.1.R32x_v20060717.jar
Could not install bundle ../../callisto-plugins/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.registry_3.2.1.R32x_v20060814.jar Bundle "org.eclipse.equinox.registry" version "3.2.1.R32x_v20060814" has already been installed from: update@plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.registry_3.2.1.R32x_v20060814.jar
eclipse.buildId=M20060921-0945 java.fullversion=J2RE 1.5.0 IBM J9 2.3 Windows XP x86-32 j9vmwi3223-20060504 (JIT enabled) J9VM - 20060501_06428_lHdSMR JIT - 20060428_1800_r8 GC - 20060501_AA BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US Command-line arguments: -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86
Note also that when picking projects, you can select any of the major categories and then hit 'Select Required' and all categories resolved interdependencies, including TPTP which depends on almost all of them. I didn't try picking single packages, just the category groups. Anyway, this is what I expected, so it's nice to see it still works since June. ;-)
There are two plugins in the SDK that also exist in the equinox feature. So when you update the equinox feature after updating the rcp feature, there will an overlap. This is expected behaviour.

bug.short_desc: [Editor] problem browsing for types in 'no target namespace' schemas

long_desc.thetext:
Using the test case from 157254 follow these steps to repro...
- open schema in to editor - add an element and call it 'object' (notice its type will be 'string') - right click on the element and select 'Set Type'->'Browse...' - select the 'object' type - notice that the element's type is still 'string'
I suspect there's something bad happening here due to the fact that the schema has no targetNamespace. In practise people use this pattern fairly frequently (usually to utilize the chameleon pattern) so we really must handle this properly!
Created an attachment (id=50754) Apply to org.eclipse.wst.xsd.ui

See line 42 of UpdateComponentReferenceAndManageDirectivesCommand.
That is why it's not supporting no targetnamespace schemas.
Target this bug to 152

mass update to remove target for all those targeted to 1.5.3 that were "normal" severity and "priority 3" (on the surface those dont' seem serious enough to fix in a maintenance release).
If I have made an error pleasae reset target and set priority appropriately.
Created an attachment (id=57734) Updated patch - covers more scenarios

The type of Element elemA from Schema A is set to Type typeB from Schema B in the following scenarios:
Schema A Schema B XSDforXSDPrefix targetNamespace http://someNS http://someNS targetNamespace null http://someNS targetNamespace null null non null targetNamespace http://someNS null non null
Fix checked into HEAD.
Adjusting target milestone
Verified using 2.0 release. Closing bug.

bug.short_desc: compile breakage from internal use in 33M2

long_desc.thetext:
In WizardClassesImportPage1 which extends WizardResourceImportPage there is several uses of selectionGroup field from the superclass. That field is documented as "clients should not use, it whould have been marked private". None the less, may do! (even in base code).
But, 33M2 caues cmpile errors in createFileSelectionGroup due to this problem (some methods change to handle sorting better).
So, we could "fix" to use the new way, but in reality, I could not find a good reason for that method to be there. It appears createFileSelectionGroup was just "copied down" from the super class ... I'm sure for a good reason at the time :) but I'm wondering if we can just delete that method.
I've marked as "blocking" since we won't be able to build on Eclipse 33M2 until this is fixed.
Just changing Version and target to hopefully make clear this is a 2.0 issue.

I've looked at this again, and it's pretty clear the method that isn't compiling can just be deleted. I suspect more of this class could also be deleted if not deleted altogehter -- and hope someone does so eventually.
But, for now, I will commit and release the fixed version so we'll at least compile on 3.3. M2.
BTW, the fundamental problem here is that this is another case where using "internals" has hurt us.
I also cleaned up manifest.mf, please removed the not needed method.
Closing as verified.

bug.short_desc: Using factory methods for converting to/from Strings and EDataType values in label editor parser

long_desc.thetext:
The EMF-generated factories include methods for converting to from String objects and EDataType values (convertXXXToString and createXXXFromString), but these are not used by the label editor parser.
To fix this, the getValidValue and getValidNewValue methods in the generated XXXAbstract Parser should use EcoreUtil.convertToString(EDataType, Object) and EcoreUtil.createFromString(EDataType, String). I also think the existing getValidNewValue code may be greatly simplified, because EMF already includes EDataTypes, and hence convertion methods, for many standard Java classes.
Changing component as the bug seems to describe issues of generated IParser implementation.

bug.short_desc: Need to improve bug reporting options

long_desc.thetext:
The MTJ project needs to improve the available options for bug reporting for the project. First, there is a need to break down the versions so that developers can be able to track bugs back to the correct code. Second, the current list of components is too general. I would suggest that you need (at least) the following component categories in order to better track the problems:
UEI Devices Preverification Builder User Interface Signing Deployment MTJ projects Device Support Security
I'm sure there are others, that will better help distinguish the problem area and direct it to the correct developer.
In addition to the previous things to be added, there is the need to allow whether this bug is a bug or enhancement request.
We need to check this

You can set enhancement in the Severity field. For the categories you have listed: UEI Devices Preverification Builder User Interface Signing Deployment MTJ projects Device Support Security
I would just call Preverification Builder, Preverification. This is a good start to the list. We also need to add a version of 0.7 and 1.0 and a Target Milestone of 0.7.

I would propose the following categories. They are very much like Craig proped, only slight changes. My purpose was to harmonize the terminology here and waht is used in our documentation.
General (assigned to Petri/Rauno) Web (assigned to Petri/Rauno) Document (assigned to Petri/Rauno) SDK Management (assigned to Arto) Project Builder (assigned to Arto) User Interface (assigned Arto) Signing (assigned to Rodrigo) Deployment (assigned to Arto) MTJ projects (assigned to Kevin) Security Management (assigned to Rodrigo)
Then we also need to define Version. I propose that we use 0.7 1.0
and then we need to add Target Milestone fields

I would prefer that we have a mail alias to route undecided or general bugs, and then let someone assign it to themselves if appropriate. Any non-critical bugs left when we have a meeting, could be assigned at that time, or critical bugs will require assignment within some fixed time after submission.

Hi,
I added those new components and at least as temporary solution added responsible persons as Petri proposed.
We can still improve situation with mailing list if we will.
But I will close the bug now and lets reopen it if we want to do further actions.
mho
(In reply to comment #4) > I would propose the following categories. They are very much like Craig proped, > only slight changes. My purpose was to harmonize the terminology here and waht > is used in our documentation. > > General (assigned to Petri/Rauno) > Web (assigned to Petri/Rauno) > Document (assigned to Petri/Rauno) > SDK Management (assigned to Arto) > Project Builder (assigned to Arto) > User Interface (assigned Arto) > Signing (assigned to Rodrigo) > Deployment (assigned to Arto) > MTJ projects (assigned to Kevin) > Security Management (assigned to Rodrigo) > > Then we also need to define Version. I propose that we use > 0.7 > 1.0 > > and then we need to add Target Milestone fields >
new categories added and also new responsible persons

long_desc.thetext:

bug.short_desc: Feature installation fails due to mirror selection

long_desc.thetext: In bug 156979, I've tried to install UML2 using the update site. This works fine when not using mirrors. Once 'Automatically select mirror' is turned on, the install fails as no features to install are found. It seems that the (automatically) selected mirror site does not fully mirror the UML features. My proposal is that the mirror selection should automatically fall back to the original site or any of the other mirrors if the mirror does not offer the same (full) content as the original site.

I think this is a dupe of bug 145235
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 145235 ***
Not quite- in my case the mirror was physically available, but did not have the original content. Both issues should be addressed.
Update Manager cannot be responsible for mirror content. Garbage in, garbage out.

For sure. It might know though that original site is fine and mirror not- and in this case switch to next mirror or back to original site? Since the mirrors are auto-discovered, that should be possible?

bug.short_desc: Provide edit-in-place for security preference directory

long_desc.thetext:
0.7M1 - User Interface - Security
The MTJ -> Security preference page provides the ability to edit the directory for the location of the keytool. Allow the user to edit that location in-place within the table rather than requiring them to open an edit dialog.

The security preferences table was intentionally implemented as read-only, intended to display information regarding the security plug-ins. It was modeled after many of the other preference page contributions (the Java -> Installed JREs contribution in particular). For the sake of conforming to the standard already set, I suggest we keep the Security preferences page as is.

I disagree with this comparison. The Installed JRE's have a significant number of changeable fields, whereas there is only a single changeable field for this page. Making the user open a dialog to make the change makes for extra steps.

The security preferences page was definitely modeled after the installed JREs table. Regardless of the number of editable fields on the table, if a user wishes to only change the location of the installed JRE, they would be required to select the appropriate JRE in the table, Select the "Edit" button, and enter the new JRE location. There are many tables in the preferences dialog that seem to follow the same process (see Java->Editor->Hovers for a table with only one editable field). The intention here is to adhere to the established standard.

(In reply to comment #0) > 0.7M1 - User Interface - Security > The MTJ -> Security preference page provides the ability to edit the directory > for the location of the keytool. Allow the user to edit that location in-place > within the table rather than requiring them to open an edit dialog.
Any additional comments. Should this be closed? Other opinions?
mho
*** Bug 158444 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 158445 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Given that this is modelled after other existing pages that don't have this feature, we are closing this bug. Please comment if there are other questions.
closing since this has been in wontfix for a month.

bug.short_desc: Security Provider preference description does not help

long_desc.thetext:
0.7M1 - User Interface - Security
The MTJ -> Security preference page shows 3 different security providers. It is unclear from the page what the difference is for each of these providers and why one would choose a specific one. Providing a description text box with further information would be very helpful in selecting the correct provider.
If this is purely a case of "what I have available", it might be better to use an "import" paradigm similar to the devices. That way the user only has to see the things that they've imported and have available.

The Security preference table lists all available (installed and active org.eclipse.mtj.core.securityManagement extensions). The base MTJ package includes 3 of the said plug-ins to support as many security tools as possible. Some users might want to use SUN based tools, some might want to use IBM WEME based tools. Users can add other securityManagement extensions by installing new plug-ins. The help documentation describes the 3 three different extensions, and how to configure them. That said, I agree that an extra sentence explaining what is listed on the table might be helpful.
Perhaps something along the lines of:
"This table lists the available Security plug-ins." "To enable the security plug-in you wish to use, mark the check box that corresponds to the desired plug-in."

Hi,
Could you do those proposed changes?
mho
Created an attachment (id=51404) applied proposed messages
Applied minor patch with message change to code. Updated message to add message about selecting a location.
messages updated.

Providing a description text box with further information would be very helpful in selecting the correct provider.
If this is purely a case of "what I have available", it might be better to use an "import" paradigm similar to the devices. That way the user only has to see the things that they've imported and have available.

The Security preference table lists all available (installed and active org.eclipse.mtj.core.signingProvider extensions). The base MTJ package includes 2 of the said plug-ins to support as many signing tools as possible. Some users might want to use SUN WTK based tools, some might want to use IBM WEME based tools. Users can add other signingProvider extensions by installing new plug-ins. The help documentation describes the 2 different extensions, and how to configure them. That said, I agree that an extra sentence explaining what is listed on the table might be helpful.
Perhaps something along the lines of:
"This table lists the available Signing provider plug-ins." "To enable the Signing provider plug-in you wish to use, mark the check box that corresponds to the desired plug-in."

The signing preferences table was intentionally implemented as read-only, intended to display information regarding the security plug-ins. It was modeled after many of the other preference page contributions (the Java -> Installed JREs contribution in particular). For the sake of conforming to the standard already set, I suggest we keep the Signing preferences page as is.

I disagree with this comparison. The Installed JRE's have a significant number of changeable fields, whereas there is only a single changeable field for this page. Making the user open a dialog to make the change makes for extra steps.

The signing preferences page was definitely modeled after the installed JREs table. Regardless of the number of editable fields on the table, if a user wishes to only change the location of the installed JRE, they would be required to select the appropriate JRE in the table, Select the "Edit" button, and enter the new JRE location. There are many tables in the preferences dialog that seem to follow the same process (see Java->Editor->Hovers for a table with only one editable field). The intention here is to adhere to the established standard.
This is a dublicate with #158442
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 158442 ***
closing as duplicate.

bug.short_desc: Peer monitoring on RAC using a multi-ip machine binds to invalid IP

long_desc.thetext:
I have a machine that has multiple IP address (some on a local private network - 10.x.x.x) and some on a corporate network. It also has multiple NIC cards. When I run the AC on this machine and attempt to do dynamic discovery (aka. the remote peer attach) the remote agent controllers ask the client workbench to connect to the newly discovered peer agent. In doing so, the workbench gets an IP address from the AC code, this IP is the location where this new agent has been discovered. When an agent is discovered on this multi-IP machine, the client is given a private network IP (10.x.x.x), which is not accessible by the client. (See screen cap attached).
My question is, how does the AC determine which IP is the IP of the peer machine on a multi-IP machine? Is there a way to startup the AC and override the IP that it programmatically determines (ie. via command line args?)
Email between Ashish, Karla, Andy, Kevin and Samson: Ashish,
I noticed this as a potential problem when I was doing the design for peer monitoring for backward compatibility. I wasnt entirely clear how the RAC handled the scenario of multiple IP addresses. It didnt look to me like it did anything special to account for that.
If youre running the AC with the backward-compatibility transport layers, I believe it calls getsockname, passing in the socket it is has used to connect to the peer AC. So if the two ACs are connected across a different network than the client will use to connect to the AC, this could result in the behavior youre seeing.
I think the RAC did things in this same way, so I would expect that youd see a similar problem using the RAC instead of the AC. Let me know if that isnt the case.
Either way, it sounds like a bugzilla report is in order.
-Andy
Input from Samson: Hi guys,
I think Andy is right. The RAC is using the socket function "getsockname()" on the socket to retrieve its own IP. The socket is the one returned from the connection to the peer RAC.
Regards,
Samson Wai (samwai@ca.ibm.com)
Created an attachment (id=50758) Screenshot showing the AC uses a 10.x IP in the command structure

I found this issue on TPTP 4.2.1.
Be mindful that consuming products are affected by this issue.
Raising as a blocker since this is needed in a consuming product that uses TPTP 4.2.1.

Targetting to i3 since this is a niche, so I don't think it should block overall testing of 4.3 in i2.
Discussions on how to fix this are occurring. The fix is going to require a change in what gets communicated between the peers in order to support multiple IPs. This means that all the platforms involved in this kind of distributed scenario will have to update to the 4.3 release if one of the systems has multiple IPs.
The trick is to allow peer monitoring to continue to work between a system with 4.3 installed and one that has an older release, that does not need the multiple IP support (i.e., support backwards compatibility).

Copying Joe and adding his follow-up email regarding whether this bug was a blocker for 4.2.1 from Sept 25 Platform call discussion:
I spoke with Kent and Dave H. about this defect, and the consuming product is not requesting that we stop 4.2.1 for a fix. However, they are requesting the following:
1) The defect should continue to be treated as a critical defect, with Samson investigating and fixing ASAP (in 4.3.) 2) Once a fix has been identified and checked into 4.3, we request that a branch be created off of the 4_2_1 branch in CVS. We'd like this fix to be available on that branch (we could choose to call it 4_2_1_1, or something else.) 3) When the fix has been committed to that branch, we'd like a build from the branch.
We're not requesting an official TPTP release vehicle for this new branch, nor do we expect to require any test pass on the build produced from it.
Thanks, --Joe
Joe Toomey Senior Software Engineer Rational Software IBM Software Group

It was determined that a new Agent Controller command has to be added in order to accommodate this functionality without breaking backward compatibility.
Passing a single hostname in the new command may not be sufficient since a machine might be residing on 2 or more network domains. Therefore the hostname as seen by a peer AC on the same network might not be the same as the one as seen by the external client which is on a different network.
Therefore I would recommend passing all IP address the first AC knows to the peer AC. Just like the Java API InetAddress.getAllByName(). Passing hostnames is also ok but this will cause the message to have arbitrary message length.

After some thinking I think the multiple IP issue may not be solved by passing the all known IP addresses to the peer AC. In the described scenario, the requesting agent/AC is in a corporate network and possibly inside a network router and firewall. To public clients outside of the corporate network, the IP address to be used is NOT any of the addresses known to the requesting AC. It should be either 1) the router address and port, which is then mapped to the requesting AC's address/port, or 2) a NIC which is connected to the public network accessible by the outside clients.
Therefore I will suggest an alternative solution by adding a new method for agents to pass in the InetAddess and port to use for client to connect. For example:
requestMonitorThroughPeer2(peerAddr, peerPort, peerAgent, myAddr, myPort, timeout);
This will solve both the "behind the router" and "public connected NIC" issue. In theory we can determine the IP address of the "public connected NIC" but unfortunately the AC cannot detect the existance of a router.
How will an agent know which IP to pass into the API? I think the agent runs into the same problem of trying to determine which IP to use. No?

So, do you think it makes sense to add a configurable entry in the AC for overridding the IP address and port when sending the request peer monitoring commands?
<TransportLayer loadlib="tptpCCTL" type="TPTP_CCTL"> <Configuration> ... <ExternalAddress hostname="10.x.y.z" port="10012"/> ... </Configuration> <CommandExtractor>tptpCmdExtr</CommandExtractor> </TransportLayer>
This way the AC will forward its external IP as 10.x.y.z and port 10012. This way, clients from exteral networks can use these information to connect to the AC, regardless of whether the AC is behind the router or using a public connected NIC.
Any comment on this?

I think we're on the right path in providing a way to override the IP or allow a user to provide the IP that is used during the transport.
From a AC perspective, I think what Samson is saying makes sense. However, from a consumability perspective, I think we're asking too much for a user to go in an modify XML file. Can we look at the following: 1) Provide a step in the SetConfig to ask the user what IP they want to use. 2) Start the AC with a command line argument that provides the IP for overriding: RAServer.exe -ipAddress=10.x.y.z.
Something like this I think is easier to consume and document to a user.

Ashish, I prefer the command line argument approach. So a tentative solution is to use command line argument as an override for IP address and port.
RAServer -mappedAddress=10.x.y.z -mappedPort=10012
Can anyone think of a better name for "mappedAddress" and "mappedPort"?
How would the argument apply if RAC is running as a service instead of command line?
There is a "Start parameters" option in the service entry when you bring up the service properties page. I think you can pass in those parameters there.

How about "-peerAttachAddress" and "-peerAttachPort"?
I'm not sure I understand what "mapped" refers to.
I'm fine with that... +1 :)

Couple of questions: 1) Thinking long term, would this address override argument also support IPv6 notations as well (e.g. "0000:0000:0000:0000:0000:0000:C0A8:6420" or "::C0A8:6420") for networks which support that nomenclature?
2) Is the -peerAttachAddress limited to IP values or is FQDN (Fully Qualified Domain Names) also permissible?
3) For systems using DHCP, will it be possible to define the peerAttach argument to probe a designated NIC (hence indirectly inheriting its IP) rather than having to define the IP explicitly which could require continual user maintenance as the IP refreshes over time (lease expiration).

> 2) Is the -peerAttachAddress limited to IP values or is FQDN (Fully Qualified Domain Names) also permissible?
If Samson agrees, I would like to strictly keep it to IP addresses only. Using FQDN can result again in the same problem of having the FQDN resolve into a local 10.x IP addres rather than a publically accessible address (as we have seen on Sanjay's windows 2003 machine).

Created an attachment (id=52988) Patch file for the RAC code base
Here is the patch based on the RAC code base.
I've just checked in the changes for the new AC code base to support the new command line options.
Also checked in the RAC patch to head: - RACommS.c - RACommS.h - RAServer.c
All fixes checked in and unit tests on Linux and Windows completed. Downstream product still need to run the testing on Windows.
Verified RAC changes on Linux and AC changes on Windows 2003 server. Changes are verified and work well for the peer attach scenario.
Closing.

bug.short_desc: EMFT OCL 1.0.1RC2a is missing plugin org.eclipse.emf.ocl.doc

long_desc.thetext: The 1.0.1 RC2a build of EMFT OCL SDK (emft-ocl-SDK-1.0.1RC2a.zip) is missing the plugin org.eclipse.emf.ocl.doc. The feature org.eclipse.emf.ocl.doc is there, and its feature.xml includes the plugin org.eclipse.emf.ocl.doc. But the plugin itself is missing from the zip file.

On further investigation, this is a problem with all of EMFT (except JET), not just OCL. All the doc plugins are missing from RC2a. The missing plugins are: org.eclipse.emf.ocl.doc org.eclipse.emf.query.doc org.eclipse.emf.transaction.doc org.eclipse.emf.validation.doc org.eclipse.emf.workspace.doc

The build.xml files (which are not generated by PDE) for the doc plug-ins still had hard-coded "1.0.0" version numbers in the tasks that look for the bundles to ZIP them up. Since the plug-in versions were updated to 1.0.1.qualifier, these tasks could not find them any longer.
I have updated these version numbers for the EMFT-OQTV doc plug-ins to "1.0.1", built, and downloaded the SDK ZIPs from eclipse.org to verify that the documentation now appears as it should. The new build is 1.0.1RC2b for OCL, Qery, and Validation. Transaction is at 1.0.1RC2c.

bug.short_desc: [planning] make scheduled date for new tasks a preference

long_desc.thetext:
When I create a new local task it comes be by default scheduled for today.
If you just want to create a local task to populate a context and forget to clear this setting, the task will be marked as red on next day.
Shouldn't be better to make it not scheduled by default? Or at least make this a preference?

Willian: we are not quite ready to make this a preference, because we want to encourage use of the planning facilities and make the "Focus on Workweek" mode the 'default' for the Task List. And when in this mode a new task won't show if it is not scheduled. However, we're trying to make it more flexible and I'll leave this open to consider for 1.0.
For new repository tasks we just added a "Personal Planning" section that allows you to clear the planning date. For now the work-around for personal/local tasks is to hit "Clear" after creating it.

UI seems clear enough now without needing the preference, since it is easy enough to hit "Clear". But resolving for later because we may want to reconsider if we have usage data indicating that many users hit "Clear" every time that they create a task.

I hit clear most times :)
Mik, I see here 2 use cases:
1 - For you and other commiters that work most of time on Mylar, it makes sense to always schedule the task (because there is a great possibility that the bug will be investigated by yourselves.
The same apply to me when I open some bug for my own product on my company.
2 - For me and other users, it does not makes sense to schedule the task because we are very likely to *** NOT *** resolve it by ourselves. It is very unlikely that a customer will submit a patch to fix a bug in my product (ahh, it would be great if they do this :).
IMHO, I see case (2) as the most predominant.
I'm OK regarding the "resolved later", unless it becomes a "resolved never" :)

Fair enough, but for 1.0 I'm hoping that case 2 is easy enough with that single "Clear" click until we figure out how to integrate this preference (e.g. it could be a check box that enables the Schedule For), and is sticky across editors so that if you uncheck it once it stays unchecked. I'm quite happy with resolving this in that way since it avoids forcing people to go to the prefs dialog.
While I don't think think that RESOLVE LATER is RESOLVE NEVER, we have not yet demonstrated that ;) So reopening, and we now have a very reasonable way to implement (after 1.0).
Rob: this is similar to the check box I've suggested to control reopening the editor on submit.

(In reply to comment #4) > Fair enough, but for 1.0 I'm hoping that case 2 is easy enough with that single > "Clear" click until we figure out how to integrate this preference (e.g. it > could be a check box that enables the Schedule For), and is sticky across > editors so that if you uncheck it once it stays unchecked. I'm quite happy > with resolving this in that way since it avoids forcing people to go to the > prefs dialog. >
I'm still favorable to make it "not scheduled" by default, since I feel that case (2) will be the most used, and for case (1), it is very likely that you won't resolve it today, so you'll have to change the value anyway.
So, IMHO, NOT making a preference and just leaving "not scheduled" by default would be the best simple option for the 2 cases.
> While I don't think think that RESOLVE LATER is RESOLVE NEVER, we have not yet > demonstrated that ;) So reopening, and we now have a very reasonable way to > implement (after 1.0). >
Yes, I was just joking with the common Platform's practice. See: bug#157642.

Hi, I'd like to bring back this bug to consideration.
It is really annoying to have to clear the scheduled date every time I open a bug on eclipse.org.
This setting is useless when I'm wearing my bug-reporter hat.

+1. I think scheduling only makes sense for developers who are working on particular project, and ratio of those developers to the people who report bugs is quite low. So, it should be either defaulted to none, or there should be a preference.

+1. I'm not sure if the ratio of people reporting bugs is higher, because my understanding is that most industry developers do not report bugs. However, this needs to be optional. It will be very straightforward to implement by making the schedule option sticky, which should cover the common cases (users who switch between wanting to have bugs scheduled and not scheduled may end up using this option).
Anyone who wants this feature interested in providing a patch?

It turns out that there is still some design discussion left around this, so I'm removing the helpwanted status until we have a clear implementation plan. Also, it is related to other planning preferences. Rob and I chatted about this and we figure that one of the following should be most simple: 1) Make the option sticky in the editor. Tradeoff is that it can't be configured per repository. 2) Make the option configurable with repository settings (e.g. one repository used mostly for team tasks vs. another used for bug reporting). 2) Make the option on a new Planning/Scheduling section of preferences.
We were leaning towards a combo of (1) and (3) and avoiding the UI complexity of per-repository settings.
I'd say (2) would be more transparent then (3). You just need to make "sticky" setting unique to the repository (or better repository + project + component).

Yes, (2) has those benefits, but I would like to point out that the benefit is not without cost because results in a considerably more complex UI: * We need to have a Planning section in both Task Repository Properties and Preferences, or have a complicated Planning section under Preferences that allows per-repository configuration. * When users see the setting in a New Task editor they need to understand that it can be different for different repositories.
In other words, there would need to be more users who benefit from the "schedule for some repositories" setting than users who benefit from the additional simplicity of the "always/never schedule setting".
Eugene: I'm not asking you to acknowledge the importance of this reasoning because I know that you have a preference to more powerful and sophisticated UIs, but as with all other UI decisions complexity will be a key factor in deciding how this is resolved.

It seems like you are still misunderstanding my suggestion. The behavior I am suggestion don't require any settings or preferences, but task editor will just have sticky settings that would match to the last choice for given project/component.
With initial values set to "none" most of the users won't see the difference, and you'll need to choose those settings once for each component when creating new tasks in the task editor and then will practically have the current behavior after that. To me it will be the most natural, simplistic and adaptive UI.

If this is purely automatic, and not explicitly visible in a preference, there is the UI burden of users needed to understand the policy (bullet point 2 in comment#12). If we were convinced that it is completely obvious then we wouldn't have to worry about it as much. But I'm not convinced, and we also have to consider the case that some repositories could want to have scheduling on by default and others off, adding to confusing if there is no explicit setting.

I think just repository will be confusing, so it better be repo/project/component. I don't think preference would be useful nor will help with awareness because users don't look into the global preferences and it don't really make sense to have such setting at the repository level, because it is only specific to task editor UI.
As for the visibility, we could use existing awareness features, including UI decoration and tool tips on those widgets, as well as the standard help system.

bug.short_desc: [patch]invalid facet extension markup for facet category in rico, dojo, zimbra.

long_desc.thetext: See bug 158460 for genertor issue. This patch fixes the actual plugin.xml markup for the personnalisties.
Created an attachment (id=50763) Fix for facet category markup

The the category element in project-facet is correct. This may be a Plugin-Manifest editor bug. Below is the scheme definition for project-facet. I will check around and transfer or close this bug.
<element name="project-facet"> <annotation> <documentation> Declares a project facet. A project facet can be thought of as a unit of functionality that the user can add to the project when the functionality is needed. Note that a facet need to have a least one version declared in order to be useful. See project-facet-version for more details. </documentation> </annotation> <complexType> <sequence> <element ref="label"/> <element ref="description" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <element ref="version-comparator" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <element name="category" type="string"> <annotation> <documentation> Project facet can optionally belong to a category. This specifies the category id. </documentation> </annotation> </element> </sequence> <attribute name="id" type="string" use="required"> <annotation> <documentation> Project facet identifier. </documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType> </element>

Ben: The project facet markup is fine, my mistake. This is the facet markup in the XSD that is wrong for org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.facets . PDE balks at elements defined inline at want them defined as a ref to provide UI assistance in the exnstion tab of the manifest editor. I am submitting a bug to WTP facts for that. There are quite a few other places where the afcet markup seems wrong too.
Closing :-P
See bug 158923 and bug 159025 that explain why this problem is in fact related to PDE UI and WTP common.

bug.short_desc: [Editor] Add search for references into source view

long_desc.thetext: Adding the 3 search for reference actions into popup menu of the source view

Created an attachment (id=50765) for org.eclipse.wst.xsd.ui
Because there is problem from StructuredTextEditor.java, the enablement of the 3 actions may appear to work incorrectly.
The problem in StructuredTextEditor.java maybe because of the way SelectionChangedEvent is fired, when no text is highlighted and the cursor is changed.

Not sure exactly what the problem is, but have you seen http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/wst/components/sse/designs/EditorSelection.html
If not, perhaps it would help. For example, do you know cursor movements are reflected in post selection events?
If you have read it, perhaps you could further clarify how you are expecting selection events to work?

Hi sir, I expected that everytime the cursor moves to a new position which leads to the update of the properties sheet (general tab), then a SelectionChangedEvent (SCE)should be fired. for example: moving cursor from BookType to MagazineType is enough to for the properties sheet to be updated, hence should fire SCE for the ActionsDelegate as well
But it seems that the way it's implemented now is: 1) only to fire SCE when the file is just opened, we move cursor to BookType, an SCE is fired to notifed that BookType is current selection 2) Only fire SCR when a piece of text is highlighted (as you mentioned in prev comment) and moving cursor causes unhighlight of the old text.

Created an attachment (id=50771) for org.eclipse.wst.xsd.ui
Prev patch provides dis/enablement for only 'search in workspace' This patch provides dis/enablement for all 3 search actions

bug.short_desc: missing keys in messages.properties file

long_desc.thetext:
The following resourse bundle keys are missing in org.eclipse.laszlo.rct.builder_0.2.0/builder.jar ==> org/eclipse/laszlo/rct/builder/compiler/util/messages.properties
It complains about the missing keys while building the Laszlo project.
build.foundHeader=Build Found Header build.oneError=Build One Error build.compiling=Build Compiling...

bug.short_desc: Third scrollbar in content assist proposal list

long_desc.thetext:
In Java editor content assist has sometimes third scrollbar... To reproduce: 1) Write this text:
IWorkbenchWindow window = PlatformUI.getWorkbench().getActiveWorkbenchWindow(); window.getActivePage().
2) ctrl+space on the last dot to show proposals. 3) The proposal list must be wide enough to NOT to have scrollbar on the bottom if it appears first time. If not, resize it until scrollbar on the bottom disapper 4) Now, if scrolling the proposals list one by one, if the "closePerspective..." proposal appears, then the second scrollbar on bottom and third scrollbar in the right lower corner would be shown :)
The problem seems to exist only when initial size of the list was enough to not to show scrollbar on the bottom, but in the list exists proposals which are much longer as the initial size allows.
I will attach the animation to visualize this (probably weird) bug report :)
eclipse.buildId=M20060629-1905 java.version=1.5.0_08 java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc. BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=de_DE
Created an attachment (id=50767) Small animation how it works
Additional info: this happens only if scrolling NOT with the keyboard but by clicking with the mouse on the scrollbar arrow button.
This looks like another manifestation of bug 28132.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 28132 ***

bug.short_desc: [Markers] [IDE][Model] MarkerImageProviderRegistry.getImageDescriptor dirties Error log
AnimateWindow call makes SWT unusable on NT4.

long_desc.thetext:
I've been informed that since SWT added the AnimateWindow call, my SWT application can no longer be run on Windows NT systems. Is there a way to make this call optional so SWT can continue to work on NT systems?
3.3M2
Yes. We can link to the call dynamically.

Fixed > 20060925
Thank you for finding and reporting this. Since I no longer have an NT machine, I can't test the fix. Please reopen this if not fixed for sancho.

bug.short_desc: PM - Management Sub-process CPs Reference Other Sub-processes

long_desc.thetext: Disabling the Intent or Solution sub-processes causes unresolved references to occur in the Management capability pattern package. The CP packages for sub-processes should be independent of the other sub-processes.

I investigated this a bit and found potential solutions. This may not be a simple thing to solve, not without discussing the following points.
1)When removing Intent package The dependency occurs because the task "Define Vision" which belongs in the Intent package is being used in the CP "Initiate Project", which belongs in the Management sub-process. The question is: do we want to move the task Define Vision to the Management package? I don't think it makes sense to do so. So we will have to leave with the warning in the configuration. Opinions?
2)When removing Solution package The dependency occurs because Architecture is an optional input to task Plan Iteration. Possible solution would be to add a package architecture in Management package, just to add a contributor artifact (mgmt_architecture) which contributes to Architecture and is used as input in this task (adding this package to Management sounds odd though) Another solution would be to add the contributor artifact (mgmt_architecture) directly to PM artifacts list. I don't see a more elegant solution here. Opinions?

It looks like those management CPs actually need to go beyond the management process. It makes sense for them to access those other method elements, so they're really OpenUP level CPs, not Management level CPs. I suspect we should make them CPs at the level of OpenUP instead of sub-processes (like the iteration templates are). CPs in the sub-process CP packages should only reference method elements in their repsective sub-process.

As per discussion in http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/epf-dev/msg01246.html, we are changing the Version number to 0.9. That's the version against what the Bugzilla issue was filed. Target Milestone is 1.0, which is the expected version of OpenUP/Basic when we will release the fix to the issue. Later, as iterations are planned, we assign the individual issues to 1.0 M1, 1.0 M2 and so on. For now, we are keeping bugs assigned to "Content" component, but it may be moved to "OpenUP" component (waiting response from Eclipse webmaster on how to create that component).
And sorry if these changes create an avalanche of emails :-)
Cheers,
Ricardo.
Ricardo, Jim, and Chris to discuss...
For Ana to triage, move to right iteration and assign to people as appropriate.

These are good points raised by Jim in comment #2. However, this leads to a rethinking of OpenUP structure, at least for the process side. The changes may be desirable, but my take is that we should bring this to clarity when refactoring OpenUP for scaleability purposes. I'm inclined to postpone this issue until after version 1.0 is released. Can we live with this reference issue described in the bug until after 1.0? Comments, please?

Yes, this is my fault for not completely 'restoring' the presentation before switching modes (i.e. you likely had something already minimized/maximized before changing the setting.
For now you should be able to do the following: go back to the default presentation and set it up so that everything is restored (no min/max) and then switch over to the new state...
Fixed by interim work...

bug.short_desc: [model] Fix DOM->EMF reconciliation

long_desc.thetext:
The WSDL model does not reconcile properly/consistently with the backing DOM. The reconcileAttributes method does not always recognize missing attributes - especially for the top level elements names. See https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=150734 for more information.
The typical reconcileAttributes method is also triggering EMF notifications even when the underlying attribute value did not change. The code which updates the DOM is also not consistently removing the corresponding attribute when the model value is null.
The changes to make the EMF model behave like the WSDL4J implementation could be disruptive to clients who rely on non-null values in many cases. The WSDL editor is one such example.

Created an attachment (id=50770) A work in progress patch
Some ideas on how to fix this.
(From update of attachment 50770) While the bug is still valid, the patch is likely obsolete by now with all the changes going in for 2.0. Will have to be modified.

bug.short_desc: unmatch version for org.eclipse.tptp.platform.analysis.codereview.java

long_desc.thetext: org.eclipse.tptp.platform.analysis.codereview.java has a different version name enbedded inside the manifest.mf then the actual plugin version on the jar name.

Some details explaining exactly what is wrong: In build 4.2.1-200609071820C:
eclipse/features/org.eclipse.tptp.platform.analysis.codereview.java_4.2.1.v200607310100--1G955G5K_D7HBA/feature.xml contains; <plugin id="org.eclipse.tptp.platform.analysis.codereview.java" download-size="0" install-size="0" version="4.2.1.v200608311555" unpack="false"/>
The eclipse/plugins directory contains: org.eclipse.tptp.platform.analysis.codereview.java_4.2.1.v200608311555.jar
But the MANIFEST.MF file in that jar contains: Bundle-Version: 4.2.1.v200609191430
When patching the build to fix Bug 154952, the manifest file was updated but the name of the jar file was not changed to match the newer version number.
Hubert, now that the 'D' build is out on the download site, should this be moved to RESOLVED - FIXED?
Verified fixed
Closing

bug.short_desc: RCP starting through Java Web Start - plugins is not a valid plugins directory

long_desc.thetext:
I'm developing a Rich Client Application and want to start it with Java Web Start. It works fine if I just export it as a product and run the .exe file, but when I want to run it as Web Start, the trouble begins.
I've downloaded the RCP Runtime Binary (http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.2-200606291905/download.php?dropFile=eclipse-RCP-3.2-win32.zip) and I have added the missing plugins from my eclipse 3.2 distribution.
I have made the jnlp files as nessesary and found out, that the problem lies in when I add org.eclipse.update.core_3.2.0.v20060605.jar in my jnlp, the following error occurs: (When the jar file is not in the directory I just get the error that org.eclipse.update.core is missing as a required bundle)
!SESSION 2006-09-24 22:40:05.130 ----------------------------------------------- eclipse.buildId=unknown java.version=1.5.0_06 java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc. BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=da_DK Framework arguments: -nosplash Command-line arguments: -nosplash
!ENTRY org.eclipse.update.configurator 2006-09-24 22:40:06.973 !MESSAGE C:\Documents and Settings\XXX\Application Data\Sun\Java\Deployment\cache\javaws\file\D\P-1\DMc&c\DMsite111\plugins is not a valid plugins directory.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 2006-09-24 22:40:07.093 !MESSAGE Product keytoolrcpproduct could not be found.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 4 0 2006-09-24 22:40:07.113 !MESSAGE Application error !STACK 1 java.lang.RuntimeException: No application id has been found. at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run(PlatformActivator.java:56) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.runApplication(EclipseAppLauncher.java:92) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.start(EclipseAppLauncher.java:68) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:400) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:177) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:336) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:280) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.WebStartMain.basicRun(WebStartMain.java:59) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:977) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.WebStartMain.main(WebStartMain.java:40) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source) at com.sun.javaws.Launcher.executeApplication(Unknown Source) at com.sun.javaws.Launcher.executeMainClass(Unknown Source) at com.sun.javaws.Launcher.continueLaunch(Unknown Source) at com.sun.javaws.Launcher.handleApplicationDesc(Unknown Source) at com.sun.javaws.Launcher.handleLaunchFile(Unknown Source) at com.sun.javaws.Launcher.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

In the case of Java Web start, java web start itself plays the role of the update.configurator / update manager (it discovers the bundles and OSGi-install them). The error you are encountering is unlikely a result of the update.configurator warning you are seeing. The error seems to indicate that some bundles used to run your application are missing. Make sure that all the bundles required to run your application are listed in one of the jnlp referred from your main jnlp file, and also check that you specified the property eclipse.product or eclipse.application.
Have you worked around your problem?

No it's still not working.
The thing is, I would like create a standalone RCP application and also as Java webstart. That's why I have the update manager.
When I export my application from Eclipse, everything works fine.
I take the jarfiles from the export, signs them, and then uses the same configuration files.
I'm running out of ideas :-)

It seems to me that you should try to create multiple features partitioning your plug-ins between the core ones (your app logic and all the plugins you use from RCP), and then have one feature containing just the jnlp file and including the core one and a second feature including all the update related plugins and also including the core feature. This way all you application logic is contained into one place, the core feature, and the specificities about the deployment are isolated.
- Feature Core plugin A plugin B plugin C plugin org.eclipse.swt etc...
- Feature Standard deployment includes Feature Core plugin update.core plugin update.configurator
- Feature JNLP deployment includes Feature Core. other plugins if necessary
Does this help?

I've run into this, too, and I notice something interesting.
The path referenced is valid up until the very last folder, "plugins":
C:\Documents and Settings\dmcreynolds.ASTORIA\Application Data\Sun\Java\Deployment\cache\javaws\http\Dbriones\P80\DMief\DMeclipse3.2.1\plugins
On my hard drive, there's a directory called "DMPlugins" that contains my cached jar files. But it looks like Eclipse is looking for "Plugins"

bug.short_desc: "Open Type" not appearing in Navigate menu

long_desc.thetext:
When editing Java source files, I don't get 'Open Type' appearing anywhere. It does show 'Open Type Hierarchy'.
The shortcut key ctrl-shift-T doesn't do anything.
I'm new to Eclipse (1 week), so perhaps I'm misunderstanding something.
Move to JDT/UI

It should be available on Navigate > Open Type. maybe you played around on Window > Customize Perspective? You can reset your changes with 'Reset Perspective'. Make sure you are on the 'Java perspective'
Hope that helps.

bug.short_desc: [Example] Log Correlator sample fails to compile

long_desc.thetext:
Driver: tptp.sdk-TPTP-4.3.0-200609200100
The following errors are shown in Problems view after creatiing the sample
Severity and Description Path Resource Location Creation Time Id ICorrelationMonitor cannot be resolved to a type LogCorrelatorProject/src MyCorEngine.java line 45 1159135656992 4 org.eclipse.hyades.logc.extensions cannot be resolved to a type LogCorrelatorProject/src SimpleParserFilter.java line 18 1159135656942 0 ILogRecordCorrelationEngine cannot be resolved to a type LogCorrelatorProject/src MyCorEngine.java line 27 1159135656992 3 The import org.eclipse.hyades.logc.extensions cannot be resolved LogCorrelatorProject/src MyCorEngine.java line 16 1159135656992 1 The import org.eclipse.hyades.logc.extensions cannot be resolved LogCorrelatorProject/src MyCorEngine.java line 17 1159135656992 2

Eugene,
By the Log Correlator sample do you mean the Apache Log Correlation/Analyzer Sample? I didn't get any error messages when I created this example in the TPTP-4.3.0-200610010100 driver. I only get this warning message: The image could not be loaded: URLImageDescriptor(bundleentry://174/icons/examples/newtestproject_wizbanner.gif)
I filed a separate bug for the missing icon. See bug 160091
Works in the TPTP-4.3.0-200610100100 driver.

Navid, my mistake, it should be the 'Log Correlator Sample' under New > Example > Logging > Log Correlator Sample.
I still can reproduce the problem in 20061009-0100 driver.

Created an attachment (id=51730) Patch
The following patch fixes the compile errors. This was being caused because of the recent refactoring done in 4.3. The name of the extension point for contributing a correlation engine has also been changed from org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.logInteractionView to org.eclipse.tptp.platform.common.ui.trace.logInteractionView. I updated this so that the correlation engine can be registered properly. The modified plugin is org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.examples.isv.
Eugene, could you please submit this patch? I don't have write access to the monitoring project.
patch submitted
Patch submitted by Eugene.
verified in 4.3i3 TP2 candidate and close bug

bug.short_desc: Focus on Workweek is broken

long_desc.thetext: In last dev build Focus on Workweek does not show local tasks scheduled for today and high priority tasks. It also does not unfilter query nodes that have no query hits.

In noticed empty query categories sticking once, but can not currently reproduce, have not noticed or been able to reproduce the problem with local tasks. Is this happening consistently?
We haven not changed any of this code, so I need to know if you're using Eclipse 3.3M2 in case this is a result of some view refresh/content policy on the Platform side.

I am running this o n Eclipse 3.2. Empty query I have came from web connector.
Still does not explain why I don't see any tasks scheduled for today. Maybe it has something to do with Sunday...

I just realized why I was seeing empty queries: my credentials disappeared when I moved to 3.3M2 so the queries were failing to synchronize.
Please note carefully what happens when the days switch (i.e. to Monday). I haven't noticed any bugs with scheduling or dates for quite some time now, but Rob had some trickiness there to deal with for updating our date range containers.
So, those query nodes should have been filtered out from Task List view. Anyways, right now I only see outdated tasks and incoming tasks. Will keep an eye what happens in two hours...

Weird. Those tasks reappeared in the Task List view. I checked at midnight, but they wasn't there. Then 2 hours later (2:35 AM) I can see them again. I scheduled them for "Today" before midnight and "scheduled for" time is Sep 25, 2006 5:00 PM.
Just had a quick peek and it looks like the check for if the task is scheduled for 'today' is only including up to the scheduledEndHour hour - which may be the reason it is getting filtered out.
...although since overdue they should have been visible.

I still have not replicated things not appearing. Rob, Eugene, have you seen it?
Sometimes when a query loses all it's hits it won't get filtered right away, which is a bug so we'll need to leave this open.
Can't say that I've seen this... usually I notice my tasks turning red after my end-of-day hour (not dissappear completely).
The thing is that I saw those red tasks, but blue tasks didn't showed up... No idea what that could be and as I said those are reappeared somewhere after midnight...

Just noticed something weird, it's probably a result of an import of task data which may not set up category containers properly, but it needs to be verified: if a local task has a completion date far-off in the future, and it's marked completed (i.e. goes green), it fails to appear in a filtered category.

It is 1:50 AM at Sunday and once again, focus on Work Week does not show local tasks scheduled for Monday 12:00 AM (weird default by the way). I can see these tasks as blue when I turn off the workweek filter.

OK, there is something weird going on. I noticed this on someone else's task list late Sunday too.
Eugene: could you please let us know your start/end day times as configured in the Tasks preferences page?
Rob: please investigate.
It is 9:00 to 17:00
Will do...

regarding comment#5, if the current time is greater than your working end of day time, the task is scheduled for the following day (set to end of working day hour so that it doesn't go red ON the day).

(In reply to comment #16) > regarding comment#5, if the current time is greater than your working end of > day time, the task is scheduled for the following day (set to end of working > day hour so that it doesn't go red ON the day).
I don't see it set to the end of working hour. I see it set to 12 AM, which is confusing.

This is indeed confusing, the scheduled task should be getting set to the hour specified by Work day end (5:00pm in your case). When you schedule a task via context menu Schedule for... and set it to say Thursday, is the hour set to 5pm or is it still getting 12am?

(In reply to comment #18) > This is indeed confusing, the scheduled task should be getting set to the hour > specified by Work day end (5:00pm in your case). When you schedule a task via > context menu Schedule for... and set it to say Thursday, is the hour set to 5pm > or is it still getting 12am?
Manually scheduled tasks are getting 5pm. I guess 12am came from autoschedulled tasks that probably happen on creation...
Update: I've committed the fix for tasks scheduled for tomorrow appearing as blue today.
Eugene, have you been running from HEAD, and if so are you still seeing the problems with tasks getting scheduled for midnight or has the latest patch fixed things up?
I am running last dev build and it seem schedule tasks to the end of next day if it is already "after hours".
Fixed. Tasks scheduled for today aren't given special treatment but rather scheduled for the endHour as usual.
Created an attachment (id=51913) mylar/context/zip

bug.short_desc: No dynamic help for Define a new server page

long_desc.thetext:
In a Web project, right clicked on a JSP file and select Profile As -> Profile on Server, or Run As -> Run on Server. Press F1 for help and clicked the "?" in the bottom left.
There is no dynamic help for this dialog.
AFAIK the context id is there, so this is just missing help, right? Do you happen to know who does the help in WTP? :)

Hmmm, if it's a missing help, what is the context id and which development plugin is it coming from? I can hunt the help down with this information. It could be one of my missing help contextual docs.

Plugin: org.eclipse.wst.server.ui Context id: org.eclipse.wst.server.ui.swns0000
The wizard actually comes up in several ways (new server, reuse an existing server, etc.), so now that I'm looking at the code I could be missing one of these cases too. If you still have problems, please let me know if you had existing servers in your workspace or just post a screencap of the wizard.
Created an attachment (id=51433) Creating a new server

Verified that swns0000 is defined in the documentation.
Documentation plugin: org.eclipse.wst.server.ui.infopop Documentation File: STuiContexts.xml
Contains the following definition for the swns0000 context ID:
<context id="swns0000"> <description>This wizard creates a new server and a new server configuration. A server contains information required to point to a specific run-time environment for local or remote testing, or for deployment to an application server. A server configuration contains information required to set up and deploy to a server.</description> </context>
The graphic attached is for the "new server" scenario.
Change dropped to 2.0 stream, will release shortly.
Released to 2.0 stream.
Closing as fixed since M3. If this was closed in error, please reopen.
Verified that the contextual help (F1) help is available in the wtp-I-I200704261031-20070426103 build.

bug.short_desc: EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) in comctl32.dll on Windows x64

long_desc.thetext: I am experiencing a crash in an application using SWT on Windows XP x64 edition. It occurs when a new tab is being opened in Azureus (http://azureus.sf.net). I have already listed a bug in their tracker (https://sourceforge.net/tracker/?func=detail&atid=575154&aid=1563316&group_id=84122) and it appears that the problem may lie in the native SWT binaries. I am using a 32-bit jre 1.5.0_8. It occurs using both 3232 and 3305 SWT versions. I will post a complete error dump. Thanks for your attention.

I should also point out that, like most good bugs, it doesn't happen 100% of the time. For a while after starting the program, things function normally.

bug.short_desc: Restoring disabled filters is not working

long_desc.thetext:
Mylar fail to restore/save custom filters when enable/disable "Mylar" mode for Package Explorer and Outline views. For instance I see closed projects after deactivating task when Closed projects filter is checked in the view settings. So, have to disable/enable filter to clean that.
Also note that defaults for disabling filters should be adjusted. For example, filters for closed projects, empty packages, import and package declarations should not be disabled.
Last thing worth to mention is that there is no Java declaration filter in Project Explorer view (not Package Explorer). So, methods and fields are getting expanded, which makes this view look very different from the Package Explorer view.
Will investigate this for 0.7, but it might slip post 0.7.0.

Eugene's additional comment:
> I agree for all other than "empty packages" which have a use case (Alt+click empty package, then drag in > a class). Not clear if the use case is worth it. It does not work without Mylar either. So, why bother to support such dragging with Mylar? Besides, those unfiltered empty packages bring more harm to the most common use cases.
*** Bug 159439 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I tried various combinations of filters, toggling, task activation, and Eclipse restarts, and could not reproduce this bug with the latest dev build. If anyone is still seeing this please reopen and provide steps on how to reproduce.
To address filters not showing up in the Project Explorer I re-implemented the preserved filter mechanism to work via extension points. Now any plug-in can specify filters to exclude in the following way:
<extension point="org.eclipse.mylar.context.ui.bridges"> <preservedFilters viewId="org.eclipse.jdt.ui.PackageExplorer"> <filter class="org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.filters.ImportDeclarationFilter"> </filter>
Eugene: I did not add the closed projects or empty package declarations filters because the idea with preserved filters is that interaction with some elements (e.g. import declarations) is not relevant enough to show. But there is nothing forcing the user to interact with empty package declarations or closed projects.. Could you please describe the scenario where not preserving this filter is problematic? I personally find it useful because I peridically Alt+click to find an empty Package, then do something to that package (e.g. add new class, rename, etc.).
Created an attachment (id=52370) mylar/context/zip

Mik, what exactly you would do there? Create new class or resource do allow to choose location or package and it is faster/more intuitive that way.
On the other hand, when I Alt-Click and see 10-20 empty packages I need to scroll trough it is really annoying. So, as seeing empty empty projects (I guess I have more closed projects in my workspace then open ones) when you need to browse trough some code in opened project.
All in all I'd say those are much rare activities and can be done with inactive Mylar filter.

I can see the argument for closed projects: since Alt-click is about working on a particular task, most use cases involving opening and closing sets of projects would not have a task active or filter applied. So I added this filter. Regarding empty packages, can you describe how the scenario where you see so many? We need to figure out if it is common enough.

(In reply to comment #7) > Regarding empty packages, can you describe how the scenario where you > see so many? We need to figure out if it is common enough.
Hmm. I probably exaggerated. 5-6 empty packages are very common at the beginning if you open src folder. Then few more you may see interleaved deeper in the source tree (usually with multimodule projects). So, it gets up to 10 anyways...

bug.short_desc: Fail to unfilter java files and resources from multiple source folders

long_desc.thetext:
When "Focus on Active Task" filter is active in Package Explorer view it fail to unfilter elements in when project has multiple source folders. This does work sometimes for Java classes but almost never work for non-java resources, such as xml, jsp and such. So, when those resources are opened in editors, they aren't unfiltered in Package Explorer view.
This one is particularly painful, especially for projects using Maven and WTP projects.

Eugene: you can verify that this is a duplicate of bug 149606 by referring to the work-around on comment#2 there. I tried it on the "mylarfilter" project that you created way back to reproduce this failure and this was the case.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 149606 ***

I am not sure what should I click at? In some cases there is just no package for resources (e.g. they are sitting in a folder that does not exit under regular source folder. More over, I saw that hapenong when secong source folder contained test classes and those classes also fail to unfilter. Maybe there is more then one issue with this.

Next time it happens unapply the Mylar filter, then click once on the folder and any other folders between it and the file that's interesting. Then apply the filter again. It should then show when the filter is applied.

Error log: A BIRT exception occurred. Plug-in Provider:Eclipse.org Plug-in Name:BIRT Model Plug-in ID:org.eclipse.birt.report.model Version:2.1.1.v20060922-0630 Error Code:Error.StyleException.NOT_FOUND Error Message:The style "Data" used by report.Body[0] is not found.

bug.short_desc: creationTime filter does not preserve specified timezone

long_desc.thetext:
When creating a creationTime filter on the Log View or Log Import operation the time zone specified by the user is not preserved. Instead the timestamp is converted to the local time zone. I experienced this problem with the TPTP 4.3 200609200100 build. To reproduce this problem:
1) Create a new filter in the Log View or Log Import Wizard with a rule like: creationTime > 2003-01-16 11:00:00.0-0800 2) Close the filter and then edit it again. 3) Notice that the creationTime filter is now: 2003-01-17 14:00:00.0-0500 which represents the same time but may be confusing to the user because it is different from what they entered in the filter.
Note, because the filter operation works correctly in that the correct filtered records are shown in the Log View this is not a blocking or critical issue.

This sounds like a dup of bug 157724
The input is converted to double value for query, and the double value is then converted back with ICU4J to readable disaply date. However, the value is converted back to display data based on system locale. Hence, if user inputs 12:00:00 GMT, it will be disaplayed as 07:00:00 EST if user's machine's locale is EST. This is a limitation for 4.2.1, unless locale of user's input is persisted in the query.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 157724 ***

We need to provide RSS information for BIRT build according to http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Eclipse_Build_Available_RSS_Feeds.

The feed URL is: http://download.eclipse.org/birt/downloads/builds-birt.xml
Milestone/Release build will be published to RSS manually.
Verified. Fixed.

bug.short_desc: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException in StringMatcher

long_desc.thetext:
Using 3.3 M2, I started seeing a lot of AIOOB exceptions from StringMatchder.
Below is typical stack. Its a bit hard for me to trace this result to current source at line numbers 255 or 265 ... implicated by stack below ... but, certainly seems there is several point near that code that's sensitive to string length. So far, I haven't really seen any ill consequences of this exception, but, not sure.
!SUBENTRY 2 org.eclipse.team.core 4 0 2006-09-24 20:14:15.765 !MESSAGE An internal error occurred processing subscriber events. !STACK 0 java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.util.StringMatcher.match(StringMatcher.java:255) at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.util.StringMatcher.match(StringMatcher.java:265) at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.util.FileNameMatcher.getMatch(FileNameMatcher.java:63) at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.util.FileNameMatcher.match(FileNameMatcher.java:72) at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.EclipseSynchronizer.isIgnored(EclipseSynchronizer.java:383) at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.EclipseResource.isIgnored(EclipseResource.java:118) at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.CVSSyncTreeSubscriber.isSupervised(CVSSyncTreeSubscriber.java:95) at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.CVSSyncTreeSubscriber.getSyncInfo(CVSSyncTreeSubscriber.java:75) at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.CVSSyncTreeSubscriber.getDiff(CVSSyncTreeSubscriber.java:149) at org.eclipse.team.core.subscribers.Subscriber.accept(Subscriber.java:428) at org.eclipse.team.core.subscribers.Subscriber.accept(Subscriber.java:438) at org.eclipse.team.core.subscribers.Subscriber.accept(Subscriber.java:423) at org.eclipse.team.core.subscribers.Subscriber.accept(Subscriber.java:395) at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.subscribers.SubscriberDiffTreeEventHandler.collectAll(SubscriberDiffTreeEventHandler.java:187) at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.subscribers.SubscriberEventHandler.processEvent(SubscriberEventHandler.java:342) at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.BackgroundEventHandler.processEvents(BackgroundEventHandler.java:329) at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.BackgroundEventHandler$1.run(BackgroundEventHandler.java:173) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

ah, seems directly related to the patch for bug 132260.
There is a fCharacterClassMaps[i] at line 255 in source, but that 'i' was ++'d in the while loop just preceeding it, so, I'm guessing that 'i' is one too big.

Created an attachment (id=50774) tiny illustration of bug
This just adds a "main" method to illustrate the bug. I have no idea of the "real" conditions under which is occurs, but, hoped this might help.

Changing to major, since this does prevent many projects from synchronizing (its not just decorations, as I at first thought). Seems once its "hit" no other synchronize.
I would mark it as "blocking", since would prevent me recommending it as a self-hosting environment, except I think I sort of found a work-around for the case that's appears to be causing me problems.
Its one project in WTP (I won't fix immediately in CVS (but will in a day or so), and attach a team project set, in case that helps reproduce the problem).
The project has the following in cvsignore file. And seems to "work around" the problem by putting the *.jar last in the list. There certainly is *.jar in other cvsignore files (and not always last) so not sure what's special about this project.
bin build webapps temp.folder build.xml *.jar *.war explorersrc.zip javaCompiler.*.args

Created an attachment (id=50856) here's the pesky project
in case it helps reproduce
I wrote the original patch and I will propose a fix to this bug. Stand by...

Created an attachment (id=50866) seems to get rid of the exceptions
This patch makes StringMatcher pass the character class map along with the string. I think that guarantees that the code doesn't cause an AIOOBE in any situation in which it wouldn't have before I added the character class stuff. At least it correctly reports that "test " does not match "*test".
The control flow of StringMatcher.match is wacky, and I guess I did not understand it fully when I wrote the original patch. I am sorry for the trouble I caused. If I could have my way, I would probably rewrite the method, but I'm guessing that after this incident you wouldn't trust me to do so and/or would rather not deal with it.
Regards...

Fix released to HEAD. Thanks for the quick response.
Regarding your comment, I am hesitent to release changes to the StringMatcher as it is a class that existed since the beginning of Eclipse (i.e. before my time) and has been copied many times (i.e. there are 9 copies in my workspace!). It's one of those cases where everyone needed it but no one was willing to provide it as API. I was even hesitant to release your original change since we really don't have good test coverage on the class. However, I appreciate your quick response on this bug and therefore do not regret my decision ;-)

I've verified this fixes my original failure case, as described in comment #3, by exporting head version of cvs.core (as a deployable jar) and using it with my M2 install. The exception goes away as expected.

bug.short_desc: Entries under the Contexts section of the adapter file are not correct

long_desc.thetext:
When creating or editing a GLA adapter configiration file, the names of the contexts and components under the Contexts section of the adapter include unnecessary information. To reproduce this, create a new adapter in the GLA Adapter Configuration Editor and expand the Adapter and Contexts sections. The following will be shown:
Adapter Contexts <context> Context Basic Context Implementation <component> Component OS File Sensor <component> Component Regular Expression Extractor <component> Component Generic Parser . . .
The "<context> Context" and "<component> Component" strings are unnecessary and should be removed from the names. I experienced this problem with the TPTP 4.3 200609200100 driver.
In TPTP 4.2.1, these extra strings are not included in the names. For example:
Adapter Contexts Basic Context Implementation OS File Sensor Regular Expression Extractor Generic Parser . . .

Increasing the severity of this defect because there are other things wrong with these elements that prevent them from being editted.
1) The details of these elements are not shown in the details pane to the right when they are selected.
2) The Add menu option when the Contexts element or <context> Context Basic Context Implementation element is selected and right clicked only shows the "Context Context" and "Component Component", respectively, in the list so there is no way of know which specific component is being added.

I open an existing adapter, ie. /org.eclipse.hyades.logging.parsers/config/Apache/access/v1.3.26/regex.adapte,and select components under the context sections in the GLA Adapter Configuration Editor. There is no information shown for these components.

Dropping severity to critical because it doesn't block a test case.

Patch submitted.
